caption.p: Increasing mean ambient temperature (27 °C, black lines; 30 °C, orange lines; 33 °C, red lines) decreases the cumulative probability of daily survival for both Anopheles gambaie ( A) and An. stephensi ( B). Variation in diurnal temperature range (DTR 0 C, solid lines; DTR 6 C, hashed lines; DTR 9 C, dotted lines) differentially affects the cumulative probability of daily mosquito survival for each vector species.
